contentrichtext.text: The '''Qishla of Kirkuk''' is a historical building in [[Kirkuk]], [[Iraq]]. According to the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] Calendars ({{lang-ar|السالنامات العثمانية }}), , the Qishla was built in 1863 to be the headquarters of the [[Ottoman Turks|Ottoman]] army in [[Kirkuk]]. The building is located in the city centre, occupying about {{convert|6|acre|m2}}. The word Qishla is a [[Turkish language|Turkish]] word means the place where the army stay at the winter. According to The Union of the Turkmen Artists, The Institution of [[Cultural heritage]] in Kirkuk is planning to repair the south part of the Qishla to make it a cultural centre and a [[museum]]. ==References== *[http://www.kirkukcentre.org] {{coord missing|Iraq}} [[Category:Buildings and structures in Kirkuk]] [[Category:Infrastructure completed in 1863]] [[Category:1863 establishments in the Ottoman Empire]]
